name: water pump operation, electric | water pump operation, electric | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19566/documentation

This dataset represents the operation of a water pump that is powered by an electric engine. The reference product is 1 MJ of electricity consumed by the engine. The amount of energy that is actually delivered to the water varies depending on the operating conditions and pump characteristics.

The activity starts with the input of electricity into the engine of the water pump.

The activity ends with the consumption of electricity by the water pump. The inventory includes the use of lubricating oil which results in an output of waste oil. The pump itself is taken into account through the input of "water pump, 22kW".
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production
tags: Sector: Water Supply; Agriculture & Animal Husbandry

processDocumentation.timeDescription: This dataset has no specific time period as it is based on estimations and assumptions.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is not related to a specific geography. It is assumed to be representative of the average operation of an electric pump.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This dataset is assumed to represent the average current technology for electric water pumps.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The data concerning lubricating oil use is copied from the dataset "water pump operation, diesel" GLO.

exchanges.description: The reference product amount refers to the energy that is consumed by the pump in the form of electricity. The actual amount of energy that is transferred to the water depends on many variables such as pump and drive efficiency, age of the pump, operating conditions, etc.

flow.name: water pump operation, electric
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. The pump is assumed to have a lifetime of 10 years, with a lifetime capacity of about 317000 m3 of pumped water (see exchange property comment for more details). This corresponds to a total energy consumption of roughly 128000 MJ based on the assumptions that the total head supplied to the pumped water is about 23 m, and that the pump shaft efficiency is 70% and the electric motor efficiency is 80%. The total head is calculated by weighting the total head supplied in the global (GLO) irrigation datasets according to their production volumes (in m3). The production volume shares and total heads for the three irrigation datasets are the following:
1. irrigation, surface: share = 80%, total head = 15.9018
2. irrigation, sprinkler: share = 16%, total head = 53.6018
3. irrigation, drip: share = 4%, total head = 42.9018 
The total head is calculated based on the elevation head (which depends on the shares of water obtained from surface water and groundwater) and the dynamic pressure head (which depends on the irrigation technique). The details of the calculation of the total head are provided in the three irrigation datasets. This is a rough estimation, and is based on the very simplified assumption that all irrigation systems use the same type of water pump.
